basics.name: Anonymous
basics.label: Lead Operations Engineer - Global Hawk Project
basics.summary: Seasoned aerospace professional with extensive experience in fixed and rotary wing flight testing, test management, systems integration and UAV operations. Background includes greater than 20 years of experience in flight test planning, execution and reporting and more than 6 years of high-altitude, long-endurance Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS) operations experience and 10 years total UAS operations experience.

work.name: Global Hawk Project Company Name
work.summary: Managed all operational aspects of Global Hawk high-altitude, long-endurance UAS, (2 operational air vehicles, 3 ground control stations) and scientific payload integration.
highlights: Developed initial Operational Concept for the Global Hawk UAS for NASA operations and generated testing roadmap
Developed syllabus and training materials for NASA Global Hawk Mission directors and UAS ground observers.
Led the NASA effort (in concert with Northrop Grumman Corporation and L-3 Communications engineers) to resolve unexpected developmental problems
Generated requirements for workmanship, functional test and environmental test for Science payloads planned for installation on the Global Hawk.

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Operational roles including various projects like Missile Defense Agency DC-10 WASP Structural Restoration and B-52H Launch Platform Aircraft Research Vehicle pylon construction.

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Planned test programs to evaluate operability, suitability, and engine/airframe integration and compatibility of F-16 propulsion systems.

work.name: Company Name
work.position: Project Manager / Senior Flight Test Engineer
work.summary: Roles included Project Manager and Flight Test Engineer

education.institution: US Air Force Institute of Technology University of Kansas

education.area: Hazards of High-Intensity Electromagnetic Radiation to Flight

awards.title: U.S. Army Commanders Award for Civilian Service
